an10.96:1.1: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Rājagaha in the Hot Springs Monastery.
an10.96:1.2: Then Ānanda rose at the crack of dawn and went to the hot springs to bathe.
an10.96:1.3: When he had bathed and emerged from the water he stood in one robe drying himself.
an10.96:1.4: The wanderer Kokanada also rose at the crack of dawn and went to the hot springs to bathe.
an10.96:2.1: He saw Ānanda coming off in the distance
an10.96:3.2: “Of the ascetics who follow the Sakyan.”
an10.96:4.1: “I’d like to ask the venerable about a certain point, if you’d take the time to answer.”
an10.96:4.2: “Ask, reverend. When I’ve heard it I’ll know.”
an10.96:5.1: “Is this your view: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
an10.96:6.1: “Then is this your view: ‘The cosmos is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
an10.96:7.1: “Then is this your view: ‘The world is finite …’ …
an10.96:7.3: ‘The soul and the body are the same thing …’ …
an10.96:7.4: ‘The soul and the body are different things …’ …
an10.96:7.5: ‘A Realized One still exists after death …’ …
an10.96:7.6: ‘A Realized One no longer exists after death …’ …
an10.96:7.7: ‘A Realized One both still exists and no longer exists after death …’ …
an10.96:7.8: ‘A Realized One neither still exists nor no longer exists after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
an10.96:8.1: “Then, sir, do you neither know nor see?”
an10.96:9.1: “When asked about all these points, you say that’s not your view.

an10.96:14.1: I know and see the scope of convictions, the scope of grounds for views, fixation on views, obsession with views, the origin of views, and the uprooting of views.
an10.96:14.2: Knowing and seeing thus, why should I say:
an10.96:15.1: “What is the venerable’s name? And how are you known among your spiritual companions?”
an10.96:15.3: And that’s how I’m known among my spiritual companions.”
an10.96:15.4: “Goodness! I had no idea I was consulting such a great teacher as
an10.96:15.7: you were, I wouldn’t have said so much.
an10.96:15.8: May Venerable Ānanda please forgive me.”
